snippet.title: How "What What (In the Butt)" unintentionally bolstered "fair use"
snippet.description: ...Wisconsin, state of my birth, I salute you for turning out federal judges like J.P. Stadtmueller. Stadtmueller is the man who waded into the swampland of fair use, South Park, and "What What (In the Butt)" to deliver a July 6 order that may break new judicial territory by citing South Park episode "Osama bin Laden Has Farty Pants" in its footnotes. And Stadtmueller has the pro...

snippet.title: "Christ, what an asshole" is only .001% of New Yorker caption contest subs
snippet.description: ..."Christ, what an asshole" seems a fitting caption for nearly every New Yorker cartoon, and yet it's only been submitted 27 times out of well over 1.5 million entries in the magazine's caption contest. We've found one place the Internet's trolls haven't managed to permeate.The "CWAA" revelation dates all the way back to February 2006, from a blog post b...

snippet.title: Ars does Soylent, Day 2: My God, what have I gotten myself into
snippet.description: ...Day 1 recap: Like trench warfare in FranceI ended the previous entry saying that I was going to head out running, but that did not happen. As it got nearer to 7pm, I started feeling ominous rumblings in my bellythe kind that could either be the sign of some harmless gas or the harbinger of the poopocalypse. I stayed in, instead watching a couple of episodes of The Wire with my wife, who ate a fin...

snippet.title: The next reason to put down the pipe: pot kills gaming skill
snippet.description: ...The use of marijuana has been linked to many terrible things in the media, including hitting small kids with your car when getting take out food. The government's newest argument for you to put down the joint? Getting high kills your video game skills."Getting high affects your brain in ways that may directly influence your gaming ability, many of the skills required for winning a backg...

snippet.title: Batteries: What’s here versus what we need
snippet.description: ...We mostly think of batteries in terms of gadgets like phones and laptops. Although we'd all love lighter weight, higher capacity, and faster charging for our gadgets, progress for this type of battery hasfor the most partalready made huge strides. The modern battery is largely keeping pace with our needs.But two other big potential users of batteriesthe electric grid and automobileshaven&apo...
